snippet: The Indian manufacturer, best known for its motorcycles and three-wheel rickshaws, unveiled a no-frills, low-priced conveyance offering few of the carlike comforts of the Tata Nano.
abstract: The Indian manufacturer, best known for its motorcycles and three-wheel rickshaws, unveiled a no-frills, low-priced conveyance offering few of the carlike comforts of the Tata Nano.
lead_paragraph: Our colleagues at India Ink report that Bajaj Auto, best known for making motorcycles and three-wheel rickshaws, has introduced a new, no-frills product, the RE60. The company insists on calling its new conveyance a four-wheeler, not a car. It will be marketed not toward Indian families, as Tata Motors did with its beleaguered Nano, but to rickshaw drivers, who typically pay about $2,200 for a rig. Read more at India Ink »

headline.main: In India, Bajaj Introduces the Anti-Nano
